intro: Hemsleyna brachystachya, commonly known as the short-stalked grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems that often form dense clumps. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are typically green or pale blue in color. Hemsleyna brachystachya is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its compact form and attractive foliage.
